intro: Armeria castrovalnerana, commonly known as the Castrovalnera thrift, is a low-growing, perennial plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland scrub habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
